alert.note: Alert for Flathead, Mission Valleys (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 17 at 9:44AM MST until January 18 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Heavy snow and blowing snow will lead to whiteout conditions, especially across the Flathead Valley. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Total Snow Accumulations of 8 to 14 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Mission Valley, Flathead Lake, Flathead Valley, and Polson. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, from 5 PM this afternoon to 5 AM MST Thursday. For the Winter Storm Warning, until 11 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Whiteout conditions are expected and will make travel treacherous and potentially life-threatening. Roadways may become impassable due to blowing and drifting snow, particularly across the Flathead Valley. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely dangerous. Do not travel. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay in your vehicle. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
